name: atom-netrelay

atom-netrelay.description: A tree-like view of directories and files for netrelay servers

sortFoldersBeforeFiles.description: When listing directory items, list subdirectories before listing files.

beautifyOnOpen.description: When opening a file, atom-beautify will be called on .html, .css and .js files if supported.

notifyOnSuccess.description: Will show a short (5s) obstrusive Notification when completing a Netrelay request successfully.

hideVcsIgnoredFiles.title: Hide VCS Ignored Files
hideVcsIgnoredFiles.description: Don't show files and directories ignored by the current project's VCS system. For example, projects using Git have these paths defined in their `.gitignore` file.

hideIgnoredNames.description: Don't show items matched by the `Ignored Names` core config setting.

focusOnReveal.description: Focus the tree view when revealing entries.

alwaysOpenExisting.description: When opening a file, always focus an already-existing view of the file even if it's in a another pane.

readme:
# Atom-Netrelay This Package has soft Dependencies on [Busy-Signal](https://atom.io/packages/busy-signal) and [Beautify](https://atom.io/packages/atom-beautify)! *This has been written in 3 Weeks and definitely needs more work to be Stable.* > This is meant to be used by people who are aware of Netrelay exclusively. It is an extensively hacked version of [atom:tree-view](https://github.com/atom/tree-view)! The first action when encountering a Problem is a quick **reload** ([CTRL] + [SHIFT] + [F5]) Otherwise please create an [Issue](https://github.com/Y05H10/atom-netrelay/issues/new)! ## Preface In its entirety, this Package tries to make you feel like you are working in a standard, locally available File System. While in reality it will Fetch and Cache the Files you open in your local project directory. This has several [limitations](#limitations) This Package also **REQUIRES** the [Server Side System](#server-side-system) to be Present, and it's location entered in the path of the [.netrelayconfig](#netrelayconfig) The Package expects you to use a Project Folder (Atom -> File -> Open Folder / Add Project Folder) > Adding a new Folder **requires** a reload ([CTRL] + [SHIFT] + [F5]) ## .netrelayconfig The Package will look for a .netrelayconfig file in the Project Root, containing a json layout ``` { "name": "[name]", "protocol": "[http / https]", "host": "[domain.example]", "path": "[/test/example/bbSystem]", "user": "[test@example.com]", "pass": "[password95]", "http_basic_user": "[basic user]", "http_basic_pass": "[basic_pass]" } ``` Here's a quick rundown for each Field : - name - will overwrite the Root Node's Name, otherwise the Directory Name is taken - protocol* - will determine to Protocol to be used to interact with the Server - host* - the domain of the netrelay server - path* - leading, but no tailing Slash, set the location to the atom-netrelay server sided system. - user* - a netrelay compatible e-mail address with access to the server - pass* - self explanatory - http_basic_user & http_basic_pass - use when Server Side System Path requires Basic Auth Fields marked with \* are required **Support for multiple Projects is experimental but vaguely tested.** ## Server Side System This is only documented for the sake of documenting. The code is exclusively closed-source. It has to be available at the given [path](#netrelayconfig) or else this Package is rendered unusable. ## Usage #### File Abstraction > Any file that is not .html will only have a Netrelay-Body displayed. When opening an HTML File, the function construct_html will Abstract the File to look like any Regular HTML File. The Layout in itself is *UNBREAKBLE* and will result in Saving Errors when mistreated. The doctype (e.g. ``) is only a representation of the Netrelay Server Settings and are **not editable** The ``, `` and `` attributes are required and unchangable. If a javascript record exists on Netrelay Level, it will be portrayed by a `data-netrelay="protected"`-block within the `` ```html /* Netrelay JS Tab */ ``` The same goes for Styles, only thies goes into the `` ```html ``` Should you touch or break the Protected Statements - `` - ` alert("Hello!"); console.log("I'm a body script ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡° )")

hello world

``` The Abstraction Layer will Parse this as following : Netrelay-Head: ```html ``` Netrelay-Style: ```css .body { color: #008080; } ``` Netrelay-Script: ```js alert("Hello!"); ``` Netrelay-Body: ```html console.log("I'm a body script ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡° )")

hello world

``` #### Fetching As mentioned before, this Package tries to emulate the usage of a local File System in every possible way. Arisen from this Wish, every communication with the Server is asynchronous. Since the Server *could* take it's time to answer, fetch actions in the Tree do now have a `.fetching` State displayed in striking ![#FFCA28](https://placehold.it/15/FFCA28/000000?text=+) `yellow` (depending on the Skin -> @background-color-warning). This will be the Case until the fetch is resolved. When opening a file, the Package will also open a Text Buffer in preparation, also serving as a Feedback for the User. Please also keep an eye out for the [Busy-Signal](https://github.com/steelbrain/busy-signal) as this will show any background fetches still running with the Server #### Settings The Package has two additional Settings, not featured in the original Tree-View Package. These are beautifyOnOpen and notifyOnSuccess. **beautifyOnOpen** - will run [atom-beautify](https://github.com/Glavin001/atom-beautify) on each fetched File given that it's an .html, .css or .js File the Default is true **notifyOnSuccess** - will display a small 5s [notification](https://github.com/atom/notifications) informing the User about the Success of the latest Action: (netrelay -> [add, move, remove]). Does not have any impact on error Notifications ## Limitations The way this Package works in conjunction with Netrelay has several disadvantages. #### Search Predominantly the **complete loss** of Project wide Search (default: [CTRL] + [SHIFT] + [F]) and the use of Atom's Transporter (default: [CTRL] + [T]) #### Native / Core Actions If you want to Manipulate a Netrelay Object, you will always have to initiate it using the Right-Click Menu of the Atom-Netrelay Tree. If you decide to Right-Click the [Atom-Tab](https://github.com/atom/tabs) with a Cached file, you will only and exclusively manipulate the Cached File. #### Reopen When you reopen an Atom Project, Atom will try to recover all of your open files, letting you resume your Work. In this case, the Server's ID is lost. Meaning you will have to reopen files you want to Manipulate. An adequate Error Message will be displayed. But this is still quite a big Strike in usability. ## Cache This Packages Cache works by saving everything you open to [projectPath]/cache/tree and [projectPath]/cache/preformat respectively. Actions like add, move, delete are unaffected by this. Should you decide to move a file where something was cached before, it will be overwritten on load. Thus, the Cache is meant to be used as just that, a Cache. As a side effect it could provide useful to recover an older State when necessary. (Namely the State of the last time you, as a user, opened it) ## Development #### Package At the time of writing the following Tree-View settings are broken or untested : - Always Open Existing - Auto Reveal - Focus On Reveal - Hide Ignored Names - Hide VCS Ignored Fles - Collapse directories Thus, the Settings are simply removed. #### Workflow the directory.js [reload()](https://github.com/Y05H10/atom-netrelay/blob/a97d9d808d0fb2b39a5d29d4cd51654eaad92d5e/lib/directory.js#L443) function is heavily hacked together. It will load the entire Tree when not given a Path, otherwise it will resolve the given Path to an ID and fetch the given Directory's Children. #### Patches & Hacks [add](https://github.com/Y05H10/atom-netrelay/blob/master/lib/add-dialog.coffee)- and [move-dialog.coffee](https://github.com/Y05H10/atom-netrelay/blob/master/lib/move-dialog.coffee) are also heavily patched to work with fetch responses. They will not make use of the File System anymore. file.js, file-view.js, directory.js and directory-view.js have been expanded to also feature an ID, Version and or cachePath respectively. This also includes helpers like getID() as a counterpart to getPath(). Apart from this, most of the new Logic is found within [tree-view.coffee](https://github.com/Y05H10/atom-netrelay/blob/master/lib/tree-view.coffee) I've tried my best to keep the original code, uncomment original functions and add new ones instead to try retaining readability and replicability. #### Core Functions Core functionality for [Open, Save, Remove, Move, Fetch] is found at the bottom of [tree-view.coffee](https://github.com/Y05H10/atom-netrelay/blob/master/lib/tree-view.coffee), prefixed with "netrelay" e.g. `netrelaySave: () ->` #### HTML Parsing Please take a look at construct_html and deconstruct_html. These take care of the Abstraction Layer between opening & saving an HTML File and Netrelay. #### Notice It might be possible to rewrite this, using the atom:tree-view [api](https://github.com/atom/tree-view#api) instead. This should in theory provide to be a more reliable and future proof implementation.

atom-netrelay.description: A tree-like view of directories and files for netrelay servers

sortFoldersBeforeFiles.description: When listing directory items, list subdirectories before listing files.

beautifyOnOpen.description: When opening a file, atom-beautify will be called on .html, .css and .js files if supported.

notifyOnSuccess.description: Will show a short (5s) obstrusive Notification when completing a Netrelay request successfully.
